column4: Sorry. While trying to boot with an ubuntu disk, i get a kernel panic error:
: are you able to specify further please. Are you installing from a CD?
:  could be a bad burn. Try using a flash disk install or re-burn the image
i got the cd from ubuntu. Didnt burn it.
Ronnet :  what are the specs of the machine you are installing into?
: I am assuming you have access to a computer now. Pop in the CD and make a Flash Installer with a 1GB flash disk. Use Unetbootin if you are on windows.
it's an old machine with no os installed. I am trying to bring it back to life.
: CD tray speed could too low. Use a flash install instead.
: you a computer now. Download and install Unetbootin. Grab a USB Flash disk (1GB will do) and pop in the CD . Create a flash disk installer.
i am trying to fix a friend's machine. only recources I have is an Ubuntu cd and my phone for irc
The cd works fine on my machine.
can i delete partitions through an ubuntu live cd?
: yes you can, the live CD has Gparted
